oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "City of Savannah"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "City of Savannah," a stern-wheeler, plowing through the water and belching smoke through its tall stacks. Several people stand on the decks.

The "City of Savannah" was built at Jeffersonville, Indiana, in 1902, for the St. Louis & Tennessee River Packet Company. In 1912, it was lost on the Mississippi River above Cairo, Illinois, and sank on a snag at Elkins Lodge.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Steamboats; Stern wheelers; African Americans
